Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates on a goose. Head and shoulders are missing. Mould-made and hollow with vent at back. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Gutch dates a similar figure to between 150BC and 250AD. (Gutch in Hogarth 1899; pl. 13, no. 201). Probably locally produced at the Naukratis Terracottas workshop operational in the 3rd to 2nd century BC and possibly later. A number of Harpocrates on goose figures have been found at Naukratis in the British Museum (GR1886,0401.1450), Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA489, NA490), Bristol (H2261) and are dated from the 3rd or 2nd century BC to the early 1st century BC. Harpocrates on goose figure parallels include a 2nd century BC example from Tanis (Bailey 2008, no.3071), an early 1st century BC (Fischer 1994; no. 616). Roman period Harpocrates on goose figures are more stylised and less naturalistic (Dunand 1990; Fischer 1994; Fjeldhagen 1995; Török 1995). Dunand, F. 1990. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte. Paris. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen : Wasmuth. Fjeldhagen, M.1995. Catalogue. Graeco-Roman terracottas from Egypt. Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek. Copenhagen. Török, L. 1995. Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt. Roma.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.036) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 93, no. 202)
